question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson choose a female running mate for the 2024 election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by November 5, 2024, Tucker Carlson officially announces a female running mate for the 2024 election, and the announcement is confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The running mate must be named and publicly recognized as part of his campaign for the presidency. Any speculation or informal mentions do not count; the announcement must be a formal endorsement and acceptance of the role.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and choose a female running mate?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) By November 5, 2024, Tucker Carlson officially announces a female running mate for the 2024 election, confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The running mate must be named and publicly recognized as part of his campaign for the presidency, with a formal endorsement and acceptance of the role.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Tucker Carlson choose a female running mate for the 2024 election?
question.body:
(a) Tucker Carlson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on election day.

(b) Tucker Carlson will choose a female running mate for the 2024 election if, by November 5, 2024, he officially announces a female running mate for the election, with confirmation from at least two reputable news sources such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, or Washington Post. The announcement must be formal, naming the running mate and recognizing them as part of his presidential campaign.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson's nomination impact voter turnout among young Republicans?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, credible evidence shows that Tucker Carlson's nomination has led to a statistically significant increase in voter turnout among registered young Republicans (ages 18-29) in the 2024 elections. This evidence must include: 1. Official voter turnout statistics released by a recognized electoral authority (e.g., the U.S. Election Assistance Commission) indicating an increase in turnout among young Republicans compared to previous elections. 2. Surveys conducted by reputable polling organizations (e.g., Pew Research Center, Gallup) showing increased engagement or likelihood to vote among young Republicans attributed to Tucker Carlson's nomination. Evidence must be published in a major news outlet or academic journal. If the evidence is ambiguous or conflicting, the question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will any major Republican candidate drop out of the race before the primaries in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if any major Republican candidate, defined as one who has received at least 5% support in national polling prior to the primaries, officially announces their withdrawal from the race before February 1, 2024. The announcement must be made through a credible source, such as a press conference or a statement on a major news outlet (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Candidates who suspend their campaigns but do not formally drop out will not count towards this resolution.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson receive at least 40% of the votes in the Republican primaries?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, during the Republican primaries for the 2024 presidential election, Tucker Carlson receives at least 40% of the total votes cast in any single primary state. The outcome must be officially reported by a reputable news organization (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) and confirmed by a recognized election authority. If there are multiple primaries on the same day, the resolution will consider the highest percentage received in any of those states. Votes from caucuses or non-binding primaries do not count towards this question's resolution.

question.title: Will a major scandal emerge that impacts Donald Trump's chances of being the nominee in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a major scandal is reported that significantly impacts Donald Trump's chances of securing the Republican nomination for the 2024 presidential election. A 'major scandal' is defined as any event or revelation that leads to substantial negative media coverage, public backlash, or political repercussions that could alter his standing among Republican voters. The impact must be assessed based on credible news reports from at least three major news organizations (such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) and must be recognized by political analysts or experts in the field. If the scandal is deemed to have a lasting effect on his candidacy, this question will resolve as Yes. Temporary controversies or minor incidents that do not significantly alter the political landscape will not count.

question.title: Will the Republican Party's support for Donald Trump decrease before the 2024 election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2024, there is a clear and unambiguous decrease in the Republican Party's support for Donald Trump as evidenced by: 1. A public opinion poll conducted by a reputable polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research, or similar) showing that less than 70% of self-identified Republican voters express support for Donald Trump as their preferred candidate for the 2024 presidential election. 2. A formal resolution or statement from a significant faction within the Republican Party (e.g., a state party committee or national party leadership) publicly expressing a lack of support for Donald Trump as the party's candidate. 3. Any major Republican figures or elected officials publicly endorsing another candidate over Trump, which is reported by at least two major news outlets such as CNN, BBC, or The New York Times. In the absence of such evidence, the question will resolve as No.

(2) Before January 1, 2024, there is a clear and unambiguous decrease in the Republican Party's support for Donald Trump, evidenced by any of the following: (a) A public opinion poll by a reputable polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research) shows less than 70% of self-identified Republican voters support Donald Trump as their preferred candidate. (b) A formal resolution or statement from a significant faction within the Republican Party publicly expressing a lack of support for Trump as the party's candidate. (c) Major Republican figures or elected officials publicly endorse another candidate over Trump, reported by at least two major news outlets such as CNN, BBC, or The New York Times. (a) This will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

1. A public opinion poll conducted by a reputable polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research, or similar) showing that less than 70% of self-identified Republican voters express support for Donald Trump as their preferred candidate for the 2024 presidential election.
2. A formal resolution or statement from a significant faction within the Republican Party (e.g., a state party committee or national party leadership) publicly expressing a lack of support for Donald Trump as the party's candidate.

question.title: Will Donald Trump win the Republican nomination if he runs in the primaries?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump is the official Republican nominee for President of the United States following the Republican primary elections for the 2024 election. The resolution will be based on the official announcement of the nominee by the Republican National Committee (RNC). In the case of ambiguity, the nominee is defined as the candidate who receives the majority of delegates at the convention, or is declared the nominee by the RNC, regardless of any challenges or disputes. If Donald Trump withdraws from the race or is unable to run for any reason, the question will resolve as No.

metadata.source_question: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and will he win the nomination if he runs in the primaries?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Donald Trump wins the Republican nomination following the Republican primary elections for the 2024 election, as officially announced by the Republican National Committee (RNC). The resolution criteria for each component are as follows:

- For the first condition, the question resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, regardless of the outcome on the day of the 2024 US election.

- For the second condition, the question resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump is the official Republican nominee following the primary elections, as declared by the RNC. If he withdraws from the race or is unable to run, this condition resolves as **No**.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this combined question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump run a competitive campaign against the Democratic nominee in the general election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by November 5, 2024, Donald Trump is officially running as the Republican nominee in the 2024 United States presidential election and is considered competitive against the Democratic nominee based on the following criteria: 1. Polling: Trump must be within 5 percentage points of the Democratic nominee in at least three reputable national polls conducted in the month leading up to the election. 2. Fundraising: Trump must have raised at least $100 million for his campaign by the end of October 2024, as reported by a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times). 3. Public Perception: Trump must maintain a favorable rating of at least 40% among likely voters according to reputable polling data. The resolution will be based on official announcements and reputable news coverage, and any ambiguity in the term 'competitive' will be clarified by the above criteria.

question.title: Will Trump family members campaign together for the Republican nominee in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, at least two members of the Trump family (defined as Donald Trump, Melania Trump, Ivanka Trump, Eric Trump, Don Jr., and Tiffany Trump) publicly campaign together for the Republican nominee for President of the United States. Public campaigning is defined as participating in joint events, rallies, or official campaign activities where they endorse the same candidate. The campaign activities must be reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) to be considered valid. If they appear together in a non-campaigning context (e.g., family gatherings), this will not count towards the resolution.

metadata.source_question: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 and (b) Donald Trump run for President again in 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if, by November 5, 2024, Donald Trump has officially declared his candidacy for the 2024 presidential election, which must be confirmed by a public announcement or through a filing with the Federal Election Commission (FEC). The declaration must be made in a manner that is widely reported by reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If he participates in any primary elections or the general election, this will also serve as confirmation of his candidacy. Any unofficial statements or speculation about his candidacy do not count towards this resolution.

question.title: Will either a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 or will Donald Trump run for President again in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (1) A member of the Trump family, specifically Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump, is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. (2) Donald Trump officially declares his candidacy for the 2024 presidential election by November 5, 2024, confirmed by a public announcement or a filing with the Federal Election Commission (FEC), and widely reported by reputable news organizations. Participation in any primary elections or the general election will also confirm his candidacy. Unofficial statements or speculation do not count towards this resolution.

question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

metadata.source_question: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

question.title: Will Ivanka Trump hold a significant political office by 2025?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Ivanka Trump is officially appointed to a significant political office within the United States government. A 'significant political office' is defined as any role that requires confirmation by the Senate or is a Cabinet-level position, including but not limited to Secretary of State, Secretary of Treasury, or any position with equivalent authority and responsibility. The appointment must be confirmed by an official announcement from the White House or relevant government body. If she holds an elected position, such as a member of Congress or a state governor, this will also count as a Yes. Any role that is considered ceremonial or advisory, such as ambassadorial positions without significant policy-making power, will not count towards this resolution.

metadata.source_question: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 and (b) Ivanka Trump holds a significant political office by 2025?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** only if both of the following conditions are met:

1. A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes any of the following individuals:
   - Donald Trump
   - Donald Trump Jr.
   - Eric Trump
   - Ivanka Trump
   - Tiffany Trump
   - Melania Trump
   - Barron Trump

2. Ivanka Trump holds a significant political office by December 31, 2025. A 'significant political office' is defined as any role requiring Senate confirmation or a Cabinet-level position, such as Secretary of State or Secretary of Treasury, or equivalent. This also includes elected positions like a member of Congress or a state governor. The appointment or election must be confirmed by an official announcement from the White House or relevant government body. Ceremonial or advisory roles without significant policy-making power do not qualify.

question.title: Will either a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 or Ivanka Trump hold a significant political office by 2025?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met:

1. A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes the following individuals:
   - Donald Trump
   - Donald Trump Jr.
   - Eric Trump
   - Ivanka Trump
   - Tiffany Trump
   - Melania Trump
   - Barron Trump

2. Ivanka Trump holds a significant political office by December 31, 2025. A 'significant political office' is defined as any role that requires confirmation by the Senate or is a Cabinet-level position, including but not limited to Secretary of State, Secretary of Treasury, or any position with equivalent authority and responsibility. The appointment must be confirmed by an official announcement from the White House or relevant government body. If she holds an elected position, such as a member of Congress or a state governor, this will also count as a Yes. Any role that is considered ceremonial or advisory, such as ambassadorial positions without significant policy-making power, will not count towards this resolution.

metadata.source_question: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

question.title: Will the Trump family influence the Republican platform in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, there is clear and documented evidence that the Trump family has significantly influenced the Republican Party platform for the 2024 election. This includes:

- The inclusion of specific policy proposals or positions in the official Republican Party platform that can be directly attributed to the Trump family or their representatives.
- Public statements or endorsements from key Trump family members (e.g., Donald Trump, Ivanka Trump, Donald Trump Jr.) that are recognized and reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) indicating their influence on the platform.
- Any formal resolutions or actions taken by the Republican National Committee (RNC) or state party organizations that reflect Trump family priorities.

The influence must be significant enough to be acknowledged by political analysts or experts in reputable political commentary or analysis outlets. Minor endorsements or unofficial statements will not count towards this resolution.

question.title: Will either a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 or influence the Republican platform in 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes any of the following individuals being the nominee:
- Donald Trump
- Donald Trump Jr.
- Eric Trump
- Ivanka Trump
- Tiffany Trump
- Melania Trump
- Barron Trump

(b) The Trump family significantly influences the Republican platform for the 2024 election. This includes:
- The inclusion of specific policy proposals or positions in the official Republican Party platform that can be directly attributed to the Trump family or their representatives.
- Public statements or endorsements from key Trump family members (e.g., Donald Trump, Ivanka Trump, Donald Trump Jr.) that are recognized and reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) indicating their influence on the platform.
- Any formal resolutions or actions taken by the Republican National Committee (RNC) or state party organizations that reflect Trump family priorities.

The influence must be significant enough to be acknowledged by political analysts or experts in reputable political commentary or analysis outlets. Minor endorsements or unofficial statements will not count towards this resolution.
